website_summaries.verdict: The most compact and inexpensive on our list but it's not a full potty, just a seat. However, that might be all you need.
pros: Folds down incredibly small and comes with its own protective carrying bag
Easy to fit inside a diaper bag
Fits on full-size toilet seats and stays in place
cons: The outer edges are a little sharp and might scratch tender skin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on the go potty seat
customer_reviews.text: The reviews do not lie, this potty seat is awesome. It is perfect for my 3 year old while we are out and about. It fits great in my diaper bag since it folds up small. I highly recommend partnering it with a good toilet seat cover because my daughter still wanted to hold the sides of the potty for support which grosses me out in public restrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think the average rating of this item speaks for itself. If you are potty training, have a toddler, have a small bum - GET THIS. I just started potty training my toddler and this fits any seat, you can take it with you when you go out to help ease them into the world of public potty’s, it’s lightweight, small, etc etc etc. Do yourself and your toddler a favor and don’t hesitate !
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is potty training and the biggest struggle was her pooping because she didn’t like to hold onto the seat for so long and was uncomfortable. This helps her sit more relax and we love that it is foldable and easy to take with us. It comes with a clear zip bag as well as a black sling bag. It stays in place and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TxLuvBug

customer_reviews.title: Your potty training toddler NEEDS THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best decision I made for the comfort of my potty training toddler! I bought this yo take with me to beautyconla and it did not disappoint! Not only was it compact enough to put it in my mimi diaper bag, but it allowed my 2 year old to feel extremely independent and she showed soo much courage to sit on the adult size industrial toilet. I used this one handed, so, the unfolding of it could be a little smoother. All in all, I'd buy this again, and again! Maybe a cuter color? Robins egg blue? My daughter calls it her "owl"..Thank you for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sugeim S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all potty training ages
customer_reviews.text: I love that it doesn’t have a “pee splash guard” because both my kids had troubles with sitting far enough back to not simply pee on the “splash guard” my daughter started potty training at a yr and a half and my son uses it at 3 & a half. Great for traveling and there is stopper tabs underneath to keep it from slipping around! Just perfect and totally adorable! (Also love the travel case!)
customer_reviews.author: Matice

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be perfect for any potty!
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t encountered a potty yet that didn’t fit this thing. It’s so wonderful! We’ve tried it at Target, TJ Maxx, Sam’s Club, Walmart, Red Robin, Long Horn..:you get the picture! It’s helped our 4 year old feel extremely confident in using the bathroom while not at home. We’ve been using it for over 6 months now and it still looks great. We just fold the bottom legs to keep it nice and extra flat in our diaper bag. We would recommend and purchase again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves it, it works well and it compacts is perfect to leave
customer_reviews.author: Yorlit Finol

customer_reviews.title: Thin, Safe and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This seat is GREAT for keeping in the diaper bag. It's so thin so it doesn't take up too much space, which is GREAT especially if your diaper bag is for multiple ages. You can discretely carry it while taking your toddler to the bathroom since it's so small and thin. I was a little unsure about the hinges coming together and pinching, but it's fully covered once together so there's no risk of that. The grippers on the bottom help to keep the seat from slipping and moving around. Toilets are all different shapes and sizes but this one does a good job at being versitile so you can use on any toilet.
customer_reviews.author: The Taylors

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep in trunk with a small stool during ...
customer_reviews.text: Great to keep in trunk with a small stool during the potty training of our 4 year old grandson. This is great for the public restroom with the large seats. He was a bit nervous at first because it was different looking but I helped him on and he was fine. Great product for travel or just in trunk when needed. I do keep it and stool in a large canvas bag to carry with me. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: MVP+D2

customer_reviews.title: Great travel seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little toilet seat for little toddler butts when they have to go to the potty while out. The owl ears make sure that the seat doesn't fall into the larger toilet. This has really helped my son go potty out in public restrooms. It comes with a travel bag so you don't have to put the seat into the clean diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Emi A

customer_reviews.title: STURDY, NONSLIP, COMPACT, EASY TO CLEAN
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't too excited about the price but needed a sturdy, compact potty seat. We traveled Southeast Asia for 4 weeks with a potty training 2 year old and this was a LIFESAVER! It fit all the different toilets we encountered: airplane, standard toilet, toilets that you squat over, and even just the hole in the ground toilets. Our little girl had no problems and felt safe and confident using this. Easy to clean with a Clorox wipe and toss back in my purse. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this if you are an on-the-go/adventurous family!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The carrying bag is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE that this comes with a discrete carrying bag! My daughter is excited about her "owl" and is now willing to sit on big potties when we're out and about. The reason I didn't give it five stars is because I wouldn't call it "non slip" - it moves about on some seats, based upon their shape, I guess? There are only a few points of contact for the silicone and the seat rather than a consistent band. Overall, we are happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Two Brown Birds

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until it breaks!
customer_reviews.text: Went through 3 of these in a short period of time - they kept breaking even though our daughter is well below the weight limit. Done with this product not worth the hassle of exchanging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even though it has a grip, it still slides ...
customer_reviews.text: Even though it has a grip, it still slides. Very unstable. Doesn't even fit to the most of the toilets that we tried during our travels. I'd rather put my toddler on the toilet seat itself than worrying it might collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Pugmama

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely awful. It slips all over the real toilet even though their are small gripping section on the underside; and for my sons, unless I completely undress them from the bottom down and spread their legs to push their penis down, the stream shoots straight out right onto their pants and undies. Such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Wicus Potgieter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loves this seat, especially my three year old. It stays in place and doesn’t slide around. Fits perfectly on our home toilets and public restroom toilets. It folds and unfolds easily and it’s taken out and put away in seconds, no hassle at all. It comes with a small black tote and a thick plastic ziplock bag for sanitation. The seat is hard plastic but she hasn’t complained a bit about it, and I don’t see that as a deal breaker at all, since she only sits on it for a minute and it’s a travel seat. It’s very compact, fits in my diaper bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Good look, very bad for its purpose. Got it today and my little girl was excited about her owl to the toilet ring, went to use it and I had to tell her to stay still while I was holding her because it does not attach and I was afraid of her legs skin could get bruise.
customer_reviews.author: delfinyc

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and compact
customer_reviews.text: Before this potty seat, we were using the Bjorn (great product!) but it became too small for my kid. This potty seat works well for us because it fits a bigger kid proportionally better. It is surprisingly sturdy with the caveat to not let the seat be pushed back away from the pull down tabs beneath. They act like anchors and the seat dosn’t feel secure if they don’t engage with the adult toilet seat (so far, only home use). The carrying bags are useful. My only complaint is that the bottom is not a solid flush surface. It’d be nice to wipe the bottom in a single motion versus wiping down the little boxes.
customer_reviews.author: qtsmom

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully my sanity saver!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old refuses to use public bathrooms while out, but is fully potty trained in our home. I knew if I traveled with her usual insert she wouldn't have any issues, but unfortunately it's a little bulky and doesn't fit in my massive diaper bag or purse. Decided to give this product a try. It folds up nice and neat and comes with a discreet black carrying bag. The design is cute and interesting to my kid. It does seem a tad flimsy, but I'm optimistic! Hopefully this is our solution to pull-ups while out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use at daycare for potty training. It's adorable and she loves her owl. It does fold up small and comes with a carry case so great for portability. We did notice that it leaves red marks on her legs sometimes and can slide around. The tabs on the bottom don't really hold it in place well. I'm not sure if it's just with their smaller toilets because I haven't tried it on a normal size toilet yet. I'm going to get her a less portable but more cushioned seat for school and strictly use this for if we go out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED THIS IN YOUR BAG!!
customer_reviews.text: The thought of having my little one's booty on a public toilet seat totally grosses me out. This toilet seat cover is a problem solver! I carry it in my bag with a small can of lysol spray and it makes using the bathroom a breeze. I have recommended this seat cover to all of my friends with toddlers who are potty-trained or potty-training. The best part about it is that it is so compact and easy to sanitize. I drop it in some bleach water and then let it air dry. It is so convenient. I have no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: L.P.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter slipped and fell into flush
customer_reviews.text: It does not have proper traction if flush surface is wet. There is no safety latch that can stop it from going into the flush. My daughter was setting on it and moved a little here and there singing to hereself when the seat slipped forward and she and the seat fell into the flush. She was not hurt but i think if they have some latch that can stop it from moving slide way and forward and backward it would be safer. Though we still use it and try to insure that toil surface is not wet when using the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Affan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was scared of "big potties" whenever we had to use the restroom at the store, or even at her grandparents. I bought this in hopes it would help her with potty training when we were out and about, and low and behold she likes it so much that I have to buy a 2nd one to keep in the house since she likes this better than the potty seat we have. She asks for he "pink owl" potty! This is such a good idea and I just keep Lysol wipes with me so I can wipe it down after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M.

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product considering that you can fold it. It is not as stable on the toilet and it doesn’t fit good on all the toilets( on some toilets it leaves a big part uncovered and your child’s skin can touch the uncovered part of the toilet, which makes the product useless) The silicone in the back meant to keep the potty cover stable in the toilet it’s not really working It sure does look great and the child will love to use it but you won’t be able to leave a 2 or 3 years old use it by themselves, you’ll have to help and make sure the cover stays in place for your child!
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy enough to support my 25 lb kid
customer_reviews.text: This seat is an amazing idea, however because the front is open, it is too flexible when using on commercial toilets (as in when you are traveling and NEED a foldable seat). When my 25 lb kid sits on it, one side or the other slides off the commercial seat and bends into the toilet. It eventually will snap from the stress. A better design would be to be larger (to fit more surface area onto the seat) and a closed front to keep the shape. If I could return it I would. It essentially useless except maybe for use on an incredibly small (non-elongated) toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Oconnor

customer_reviews.title: It's alright. Not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is very portable which I love but it easily moves around on the toilet seat if you're not careful and it hasn't happened but I'm always a little nervous one of the cracks from where it folds isn't completely closed when she sits on it and it might pinch her little bottom. It's okay for what it is and for the price but I don't know if I would pay for it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Yoder

customer_reviews.title: Compact and effective
customer_reviews.text: Love this little potty seat. I bought it when I was planning a trip away with my daughter. I didn’t want to lug around her little training potty and found this to try. My toddler took to it immediately. She didn’t mind it and felt secure sitting on it. I definitely recommend those when you are on the go or just need something compact in your home. It’s easy to clean and quick to unfold for use. I am deffinitly going to recommend this to my friends when they get to the potty training stage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a travel seat better than the non-travel seats.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful seat! i put it on our potty so our son could try it out before trying it out somewhere in public... my bad! He loves it so much he wants nothing to do with his conventional padded Elmo themed seat now. This one is easier for his short little legs to climb up onto the toilet, and it doesn't shift around at all! I wish the carrying case was a little more substantial (it looks like something i might otherwise throw away) but the seat itself is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well for elongated toilet seats
customer_reviews.text: Review updated in lieu of quality customer service: I was contacted immediately about problems with slipping and the side hinges pinching my daughter. She cries every time I try to use it. They confirmed the seat was in good condition and notified me that they will be updating the design for improvements. For now, this model does not work for our needs but I am hopeful that a future design may make traveling easier.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not good for elongated toilet seats.
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE- Just FYI, company was very persistent about trying to fix the seat to work for our home. This was great, but I wasn’t interested as I had already moved on to another product and the cost of this seat wasn’t too pricey that I was worried about it. BUT I received numerous emails from them asking to have me change my review, including being bribed with money. This was reported to Amazon as it goes against their policies. Unfortunately this portable seat slips around on our elongated toilet seat. Our daughter won’t sit on it anymore because of the instability she feels. Cute and compact though.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Durable  and adorable
customer_reviews.text: This works out very well. Dont use it for traveling but I can. So easy that my 3yr old does it on his own. Bought it for the toilet seat because it was too wide for his bottom. This is perfect. Allows him to sit with out falling in and enough room to urinate without hitting anything. Didn't like the bulky potty seats because it was too small. This is perfect. Even has little stopper towards the front. Great seat highly recommend for traveling and home use. I got the yellow and blue. So adorable . 3 yr old loves them
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!! Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Life saver!!! Every potty training parent needs one. We used it while traveling, and it made all the difference. I could carry it in my backpack. It folds up so nicely and discreetly. It reduced a ton of stress. just double up on the toilet seat covers. This just a sets on top of the toilet so it does slide around a bit, you will definitely have to help hold the child up, but it doesn’t set in to a public toilet and get all yucky!!! Easy to clean with bleach water, did not ruin the seat at all.
customer_reviews.author: Spark’ZMom

customer_reviews.title: Helps kids conquer fears of new/different toilets!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is easy to carry, travels well, cleans up nicely, and doesn't pinch little bums - great. However, the best thing about this is actually the "training" aspect of familiarizing a child with the same product, regardless of the restroom. We're still working on this, but anytime we go someplace new with a public restroom or different toilet design that may be unknown/intimidating, I can convince my child that it's ok because we have the same potty seat wherever we are. Our little owl friend goes with us, regardless of whether the potty is in a department store or someone else's home, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SleacoFriday

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I started potty training with a non folding put seat from Walmart. It fit into the diaper and had handles, so it worked well for what we needed, but as our girl free up we were traveling more so I did a search and found this. It works great!!!. It fits in my purse so I feel like a grown up again. I let my daughter pick which come she wanted so she was excited. We used it all over Disney World, on planes, airports, hotels etc and it worked great. I will be honest, when traveling I do clean this potty at the end of every day with a Lysol wipes (or something similar).
customer_reviews.author: Barb E. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact, but does slide around
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to fold and very compact. It comes with a carrying pouch which is very convenient. There are however a couple of issues for me. First, the seat is larger than conventional potty seat which leaves a big gap at the front of the toilet, so my baby keeps putting her hands there. Second, this does slide around a little bit on the toilet seat depending on the shape of your toilet seat, so there were a couple of instances where my baby almost lost balance when the seat slipped. Overall, good product!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: All the convenience of a home potty seat on the go!
customer_reviews.text: We're elated to be almost done potty training out 2.5 year old boy, but then the anxiety of using public bathrooms set in. This is an amazing alternative to laying TP on the seat or lugging a full size seat. It comes in a nice sack with drawstrings and fold up much smaller than you'd think to take up less room in the diaper bag. The silicon feet keep it steady on most public toilets and the bright colors (we chose yellow) keep it fun for little ones. I would definitely recommend this for anyone potty training children with anxieties about using the dreaded public restrooms.
customer_reviews.author: JayInWI

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter used it to potty train our grandson at home during the pandemic and we use it when he comes to our house a couple of days a week. It can be left on the toilet seat for the little guy and is easily removed when someone else needs to use the toilet. We take it with us when we go out as it easily folds up into a small bag that can be carried in a small tote or even my purse. We use disinfectant wipes when we're out to clean the seat after every use, as well as each time we put it away at home. Love the fact it folds into such a small, totable package!
customer_reviews.author: klzchaz

customer_reviews.title: Makes potty training a bit more exciting
customer_reviews.text: When my son first started potty training we would practice going in public places. The toilet seats were too big for him and this product helps prevent him from falling into the toilet. Anytime we went to the restroom he was super excited to use his Owl.If I didn't have the Owl our and ready for the toilet, he would ask for it!!!!! It is easy to clean and small. Fits in my wife's purse and my jean's back pocket (sticks out a bit but still fits and I am 6'1" 175lbs.) We have recommended this to our family.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious game changer! No more yucky public potty or worrying about toddler falling in. Comes with a sturdy plastic reusable bag - just pop it out, unfold, and fold back up after use. We have had ZERO trouble with using public restrooms with our toddler. She absolutely loves ‘pink owl’. We also bought a 50 pack of the paper seat covers - so I don’t even feel like I have to sanitize this as it never actually touches the seat. Clean hands and a clean bottom for my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Allie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great on the go seat - no falling in!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this potty seat because it’s so convenient when you are on the go. It folds up and is about the size of a book and fits in your diaper bag or even a large purse. I pair this seat with toilet seat covers when I can but otherwise it can just wipe down or rinse off. It makes going on a big public potty much less scary for both toddler and mommy from falling in and little bottoms touching toilets. I recommend this potty seat for parents on the go. My daughter asks to use this when we go to the stores bc it gives confidence as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, slides around
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was a terrible product and I am returning it .. I’ve tried it a few times with my daughter and all it does is slide around the toilet (usually public) so it’s not helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: I carry it for my toilet training child who loves the owl, loves to help me fold/unfold, and loves to use it. I love that it's so easy and convenient to carry, barely takes up space in a diaper bag, and child puts it to good use. P.S. We had some hiccups getting it.. we received it chipped twice and had to return it before they shipped us one in good shape. But once we got the good one its 5 stars all the way so not taking off a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kanchan Shenoy

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel.
customer_reviews.text: We recently took a trip to Malaysia to visit family. This folding potty seat REALLY came in handy. Our daughter is still transitioning from pull-ups... and she is still not quite able to fit on a regular seat. She really loved the owl design... and it's PINK! We had to take this every time she went potty. She could even unfold and fold it back up by herself. It really gave her a sense of accomplishment. Great product for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: ai98

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel
customer_reviews.text: Took it on a recent trip, and this is what I learned. It's easy to travel with. The folding is perfectly convenient and easy to operate. The fold-points didn't pinch my 2yo daughter's skin at all after multiple uses, which I thought might happen. The pads underneath along with the fold-out clips keep it rock solid in place, even in the fairly large toilet seat in our hotel. Overall, this is everything it's supposed to be, so I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: IZ

customer_reviews.title: The genius who created this should be awarded the Nobel Piss Prize... it's brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those inventions that no one thought of before but after it was invented you can't believe it wasn't already invented. It's the simplest idea, yet a stroke of a genius. This little contraption allows the child to sit on a regular size toilet at ease. It's sturdy, light, folds neatly, and will save you so much aggravation that you'll be blessing the stars and the moon for purchasing it. To save you time on all the details that can be found in the thousands of other reviews, I would only state that I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zvi M. Aranoff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for travel
customer_reviews.text: I used to be so enjoyed everytime we went to a public restroom nd there were no seat covers. My daughter is potty training and could barely hold it long enough for me to make a toilet paper barrier. Not anymore this fold up and opens up quick and easy, comes with a carrying bag, whenever we go out i just slip it in my bag or keep it in my car. Its pretty compact, about a qtr of the size of your average potty seat cover without the padding I havent see. Toilet yet that it doesn't fit just right on
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for toddler toilet runs!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have when traveling with a toddler! I bought the pink owl design and couldn't be happier with my buy. My 2.5 year old easily took to the idea of using outside potties with this (the actually potty training is a totally different story...sigh). So easy to carry around in my bag and have had no issues with the seat slipping thanks to the grips at the bottom. The only issue is that I like to wipe it with disinfectant wipes after use, and the grooves at the bottom makes it a little difficult to wipe (no problem washing though). But I guess they are necessary to prevent slipping.
customer_reviews.author: sha79

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I started potty training my two-year-old, but I forgot to plan ahead. We found ourselves at a relative's house, no diapers, no potty chair, and he was afraid if the big toilet. He asked to go potty. He did his part, but he still ended up urinating in their floor. Enter this thing. We've only used it once, in a supermarket restroom, but he used it without hesitation. It stayed in place! It was sturdy beneath a 35 lb toddler! This has made me seriously regret buying a padded seat reducer for home use! I just ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Faces

customer_reviews.title: genius!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this travel potty seat for an upcoming vacation, but honestly I feel like everyone with a toddle needs this for their go bag. My 3 year old can sit on big potties but it really makes him nervous to do so. This seat is even better than typical potty seats, like the one we bought for his bathroom. The fact that it's portable is just icing on the cake. This seat is great for small bathrooms, public toilets, vacation, etc. Well worth it! It works on round and elongated toilets (as shown in the pictures) and folds up to about the same size as 2 stacked bluray cases.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Fits many toilet shapes and folds easily for transport.
customer_reviews.text: My kid has been potty training for a week and we got this for a weekend trip. We’ve used it on several toilets including one on a boat and it fit them all perfectly. The little tabs definitely help and it doesn’t slide around. The only very minor complaint I have is the picture of the owl smudged when in contact with skin that had suntan lotion on it. Didn’t affect the function at all, just the look. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steph P.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for travel, great for home use
customer_reviews.text: I gat this more for home use then travel My girl love it and it’s easy to set up and clean If you do use it for travel - will still recommend to wipe the toilet with disinfecting wipes because there is some parts of the public toilet that will come in contact with ur child But this is better then home training toilet pice I gat before This product has the rubber under the site so it will keep it in place and that is always helpful when placing a child to sit on it Easy use easy clean easy set up
customer_reviews.author: IS&KK

customer_reviews.title: Must have for potty training
customer_reviews.text: We started potty training my 18 month old and the toilets run large for him. He was ok relieving at home but refused to sit in public toilets. This one has helped us extend his training outside home. 1. It folds easy and is travel friendly. The bag that comes with this is very handy 2. It’s easy to clean with mild soapy warm water. Sometimes I use my hand sanitizer and wipe it down 3. It stays pretty firm on most toilet seats 4. The design is very kid friendly 5. For a portable seat, it’s pretty sturdy I would highly recommend this product if you are potty training a very young child.
customer_reviews.author: Vinodh

customer_reviews.title: Best potty seat yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second potty seat I purchased, we loved the first one so much that we had to buy another one for exclusive traveling use! Awesome seat! We’ve had the first one for 4 months now and it’s still holding up great! Now mind you, that may not seem like a long time coming BUT our potty trained 2 1/2yr old is a whopping 40lbs so that’s a lot of weight to put on a potty seat every single day for 4 months... and it’s still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Darian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable potty topper.
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever for going out and about with a potty training toddler. Folds easily, doesn't pinch skin, feels reasonably sturdy, and it is compact to fit in my purse. My toddler loves that it looks like an owl, too. My only wish is that the drawstring and plastic zip storage bags were a little bit larger, as it can be a pain to get it back inside when you're juggling a million things and a child in a bathroom stall. But still... An excellent purchase and I have recommended it to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy F

customer_reviews.title: Threenager approved!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this seat. It's perfect. This came in handy when we were out and about or even while we were at a friends or family's. Easy to use, it's lightweight, takes up hardly any room in my diaper bag, very easy to clean, AND my 3 year old can actually unfold and do everything on her own. I'm the parent who researches before buying and even then I buy multiple brands and variations of products to find what suits us. Hands down, no doubt, this one is our to pick for potty seats. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Leaf Eater

customer_reviews.title: For more than travel
customer_reviews.text: This is great to stick in the diaper bag to make public toilets much less of a tush-dunking catastrophe waiting to happen. It folds easily and is compact. Minor downside: It is too big for my purse when I leave the diaper bag in the car. However, it does fit in my mother's purse. It may fit in yours. I'd guess it takes up as much room as 2 1/2 large diapers. What I didn't expect was for my son to like this better than his regular potty seat. The fact that it's open in front helps him get seated comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Diaper bag must have
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to use at home and out and about. Folds well for travel and the carrying case means it touches nothing else in the bag. I paired mind with a disposable seat cover for public bathrooms so there is literally no touching the public toilets. Both of my kiddos love the owl design. We have had ours a bit and the paint is starting to come off which is the only sad part. We have traveled a lot though, so there has been a lot of wear and tear on it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this specifically for our two year old daughter as we were headed to the beach on a long car trip. She isn't potty trained but has been using the potty off and on for a few months and I wanted to have options for her at places like gas stations etc. Historically she's been nervous to use a "big potty" but she really liked the little pink owl seat and ended up using it without any trouble every time we stopped. It will be great to use when we go to grandparents houses etc so they don't have to hold her up or buy their own seat.
customer_reviews.author: M Rose

customer_reviews.title: Potty-training on the go
customer_reviews.text: Nice option for when you're potty training, but also need to leave your house occasionally. Just throw some lysol wipes in your diaper bag to clean it up before you toss it back in your diaper bag after the public toilet. Made of hard plastic (for some reason I thought it might be a different material), and has fit all the toilet's we've tried it on so far. Silicone grippers on the underside keep it in place well. Off the toilet, it seems like it might extend too far and could pinch, but on a toilet seat, it seems to hold it's intended position well and does not pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This seat has been so fantastic. My daughter is only 19m so some of the other potty training seats had holes that were still a pretty big opening for her bum. This one is great and so easy to carry with you, rather than running back to the car to have them sit on a mini potty- doable at the park if you can park your car close enough, but unrealistic at places like the mall, or a restaurant, and forget about it anywhere you need to valet. I’m so happy to be able to just grab this seat and my daughter and head off to the restroom!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great for outhouses and publuc restrooms
customer_reviews.text: What a lifesaver! We were at a state oark/beach where the only restrooare outhouse facilities. My 3-yr-old daughter would not go and we almost had to leave until I remembered her portable seat and toilet covers were in the trunk. Phew! Fully covered everything and made it possible for her to use the facilities. I highly recommend tbese...especially if you may be camping or in a place where there are not the usual types of flushing toilets around.
customer_reviews.author: DogMom916

customer_reviews.title: We use this often.
customer_reviews.text: Now this is GENIUS!!! I tried to actually travel around my daughters seat that I got for our toilet. You know, that one that goes on top. It’s big and didn’t collapse so it’s awkward. Not to mention eww. This is great bc it folds and can be shoved into a bag. You can wipe it down after use and then shove it in the convienent little bag it comes with or clean it later. There is very rarely little seats when you’re out so you likely need something like this for your little one so you don’t have to hold them up. It’s already scary for them. Believe me. Get the seat and at least save yourself that hassle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for venturing out into the world with our potty training 2-year old. We call it her “super cute pink potty seat” and she is a fan! She had only been going on her potty chair for a week but we needed to make life more reasonable and introduced this. She loves it and has successfully used it at our house and friends’ houses. I love it because it fits in my purse and helps her go confidently in different places!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Workman

customer_reviews.title: Great for continuing potty training habits while on the go
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver for us while potty training our two toddlers. It has been so difficult for them to continue potty training habits when we are out and about, mostly out of fear of the bigger, unfamiliar potty in public restrooms. This product is very easy to fold and is easily portable. Our kids will use it while we are out since it is easier for them to sit on, as well as the fact that it is something familiar since we occasionally use it at home, as well. You can easily wipe it down to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley BuffTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great buy...
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty discreet, useful little item. Definitely better than having to carry around an actual potty ring. We keep on in the truck of each car so it's easy access during family outings. Comes in a little pouch. Folds nicely and cleans easily. This foldable potty seat does holds more than 35lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Irene L. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Makes public restrooms easier and folds away discretely
customer_reviews.text: Just bought our 2nd so each parent always has one in their car. The kids were scared of the public, big potties, but will go potty anywhere now. It has rubber grips on the bottom so no sliding around. This folds up so small and fits inside 2 bags keeping those dirty public restroom germs sealed away until you can clean it later. Its super easy to wipe off or wash with soap and water. I hate taking the kids to the public restroom but this plus one of the oversized paper protectors under it help a lot, esp. when traveling. Why must they touch everything! Ew!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Love this for On the Go
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Mickey Mouse one from Buy Buy Baby because the Amazon one still needed time to ship to my house. My son kept moving around and it would fall into the toilet. I ABSOLUTELY recommend this one because the way it folds it won't pinch your child. Which is a HUGE issue with these toilet toppers. It fits the public toilets because those toilets are typically elongated not round which MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE. Unless, you feel like putting the toddler on and off the toiler trying to get them to pee.
customer_reviews.author: GabyStaas

customer_reviews.title: Essential for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best "potty training" item that we have purchased. We keep it in the zip up package that came with it and take it everywhere. It is very portable and has fit on every single toilet we have used it on. It is very sturdy as well. My daughter is 33 pounds and it has not even warped when she sits on it while on larger toilets. We have cleaned it, as well as the storage bag, multiple times with no issues. The potty still looks brand new after months of cleaning and usage.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Nice seats that have worked for my little
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with these seats. We have two seats now and they are very nice. The plastic ends have making marks/ indentations on our toilet seats, but they have helped my daughter go from diapers to the big potty without a little potty in between. They are very sturdy, even when my little one wiggles around. Overall, these seats were a great find. We have not took them traveling yet, but They are easy to fold and store. If we do take them traveling I would use a gallon ziploc to store then rather than the small bags they provided.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Worth ir
customer_reviews.text: This was a miracle product for us. When our 3 year old refused to poop in the potty without a small seat, I could keep this stashed in the diaper bag for when we were out. I have used it at hotels, zoos, airports, and restaurants. I haven't found a toilet it doesn't fit. It golds up easily and comes with a clear plastic zippered pouch to keep it in. It has non slip grips on it so it doesn't move on the potty. Great invention. Lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Linsi

customer_reviews.title: The best tool for potty training
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this to every parent I know! My daughter was fully potty trained at home, but was too nervous when we were anywhere else because she didn't like to be held up on the potty but couldn't easily balance herself. We brought this thing everywhere with us for over a year and it has held up great. Just make sure that you clean it and that it's completely flat before your child sits down so that they don't get pinched.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, compact potty insert for on the go
customer_reviews.text: Someone in a potty training group recommended this product. We have the Oxo travel potty but it's rather large, and I couldn't imagine lugging it into stores on errands. I'm so glad someone told me about this product! It folds into a small square and comes with its own bag so it conveniently fits in your purse or diaper bag. Perfect for putting over the big toilet for your little one while running errands. Due to the variety of toilet shapes and sizes, it's not always a perfect fit, but does the job!
customer_reviews.author: janelle

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver! We use it when traveling, at sporting activities, restaurants, etc.... It's sometimes intimidating for little ones, especially those just potty training, to sit on a big potty. It's hard for parents to help encourage their children to go when they are falling in the toilet or the bathroom is just disgusting. My son knows this is his potty chair when we are out and he is excited to go! Once he is done we just wipe it up so it's clean. So happy we made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: HiFiBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler seat cover for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Love the seat cover, its solid and put together well. The rubber underneath is perfect to help my toddler not slip around while sitting at the potty. The bag it comes with is a great size since you can hang it and hold it without worrying that the cover will touch your hands. Great design overall. It is a tad heavier than I would have liked it to be but the material has to be sturdy so it can hold the weight of a child.
customer_reviews.author: The Roque's

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product and show it to all my mom friends. I potty trained my daughter at 22 months (yay!) and she is pretty good about using public toilets without much fuss but as most ladies know, not all of them have a seat. Also if she needs to poo or just is taking a long time, this saves me from having to hold her on the edge so she won’t fall in. It also has become an incentive. She never wants to stop playing at the park to go potty, but if I entice her with “the owl potty” she will go without a fuss. Folds up in a plastic bag in my (large) purse.
customer_reviews.author: H. M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am keeping one in our house for our grandsons, and I ordered one for my daughter for traveling, and we both just love it. I had something similar a generation ago for my two daughters, but it was primitive (though foldable) compared to this one, which appears much sturdier and comfortable for the boys. When my grandson comes over, I put this on the toilet in the powder room with a small step stool and he can manage for himself.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My big 3.5 year old is very hesitant on full-sized potties. We’ve tried other potty rings, but all were too big or bulky to carry around in my bag to use in public restrooms. This potty ring is big enough for a larger child, but folds down very small and is great to throw in a diaper bag or purse. When unfolded it’s very sturdy and secure — no punches in the joints, and it sits very securely on a toilet seat with no slipping! It’s been a lifesaver in public places like the Zoo and Target!
customer_reviews.author: Villain

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for public restroom potty-training!
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat has been an absolutely game changer for public potty training! My daughter was terrified of large size toilet seats and would cling for dear life every time I put her on one. With this, she sits right down and does her business with no fuss! I'm a germ freak, so I also bought those oversized waterproof toilet covers to put down before I set the seat on top. That way, the underside never gets dirty, and when she holds on to the side, she doesn't touch the seat. It folds up easily into the bag I carry around for her! This is worth every single penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat for my 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: This seat was perfect for our now 3 year old son to use when we’re in public places and it’s potty time. It seems to fit well over whatever toilet shape although it won’t completely cover some toilet surfaces. The plastic is sturdy and it folds nicely within the included vinyl bag so it keeps a barrier from toilet germs and your bag. My son likes owls so he enjoyed the character on the seat. Overall great potty seat.
customer_reviews.author: MPop

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: This seat works great! There are little stabilizers on the bottom that you can fold out for a super stable position, but we rarely use them because the rubber on the bottom holds the seat in place just fine. My daughter hasn’t ever gotten a pinch from the seams either, which was my main concern initially. It comes with a nice carrying sac that keeps the seat from touching everything in my purse. It’s literally the perfect solution for public restrooms!
customer_reviews.author: Richard O. Baize

customer_reviews.title: Travel friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great potty and over all I would repurchase. I just slide it in my diaper bag and it barely takes up any room. Its not flimsy and very easy to clean. My only complaint and why I gave it four instead of five stars is bc it is wobbly on the toilet. It slides and you have to readjust your toddler and the seat. I also wish it had a lip in the front or something to catch pee that can accidentally spray out of the potty and on a toddlers pants :( We have had a few accidents this way.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona25

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice, but not the most sanitary???
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great product, but I returned it because it wasn't what I expected. I wanted the bottom, the part that sits on the toilet, to be flat so I could easily sanitize it after each public use. It turns out it has lots of grooves and I didn't want to mess with cleaning all those nooks and crannies. Instead, I just take a wet ones wipe and wipe the toilet down when my little one needs to go potty. If the grooves don't bother you this is cute. Lastly, the bag it fits in is quite small, so it has to be stuffed in there just right...
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Potty Taining Miracle
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I didn't wait to purchase this! We're currently going through potty training with our 2 year old, and this has helped immensely. We go out frequently and having her use the normal/adult size potty was intimidating to her, causing more accidents than I'd like to admit to. We had a family outing recently and we were accident free, she was even excited to use her seat. Highly recommend it for any parent going through potty training with their toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THISSSS
customer_reviews.text: We love this potty seat as we all know our kids are intimidated of the big scary potty!! I actually use this for travel and home since we have two bathrooms and she will go whichever bathroom we are close to. Out in public this is so perfect for public bathrooms. Makes it so much easier on me to not have a meltdown of a scared child on the toilet, she is now confident using the large public bathrooms with her seat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda silva

customer_reviews.title: Great Toddler Potty Seat...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 y/o who just potty trained for traveling outside the house. It is amazing. It folds perfectly and fits right in our diaper bag for convenience. It does not pinch our little ones bottom and has more than enough surface for her to sit comfortably to use the restroom. Definitely a recommended product for any new toddler using the potty.
customer_reviews.author: JHW-California

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: So, I ordered this with very low expectations. Boy have I been pleasantly surprised! This thing has come in handy so many times!! I love it! When my nine year old was potty training, I kept a little potty in my car at all times. Bulky and kinda gross. This thing would have been AMAZING to have. Especially with a little girl. I keep it in my purse along with antibacterial wipes and it works like a dream. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic,  may pinch a wiggling kid? Hasent happened yet but I'm nervous.
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic, somewhat worried my little wiggle worm will get his bum or leg pinched, havent tested it yet but it feels pretty secure on the potty and even has little owl tabs to flip out to make it more secure with the rubber bottom. I'd what but in my min I thought it would feel softer more like silicon. But it will hopfully keep him from falling in the public pottys when we r out, very convient to bring on the go, wish the bag was a bit roomier to place some paper seat covers in there with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Best toilet travel seat!
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat is a must have for a newly potty trained toddler. It works on any toilet seat securely and is so easy to use. It comes with a little travel bag for the seat with a little extra room which we used to throw in some cleaning wipes. It folds compactly and is very easy to to clean. We just got back from vacation with our 2 year old in Europe, it worked on the airplane, train, and any other toilet we used without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: akula34

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping and travel
customer_reviews.text: Love the compact fold! I bought this to keep in our travel trailer when we go camping. It is so compact for our limited bathroom space. The only problem is that if you have a boy who isn't fully potty trained, there is no splash guard. I bought it for the space saving - so that hasn't been a problem for me. I just wouldn't buy it for the purpose of potty training little boy at home.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: "Owwww" is what my tot says after I put her on it
customer_reviews.text: Great concept and uber compact in the diaper bag. Will recommend for moms who has a child is already potty trained and no need to rush. It seems to be my tot's absolute least favorite potty seat. She preferred to pee on her pants than seat on it, since it pinches her butt whenever she seats on it. Returning it and will try other brand that I can carry around
customer_reviews.author: Husband&Wife518

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Both my twin toddlers love this better than their training potty. We are going on a trip so I bought this to help them use the bathrooms in airports and when we get to our destinations. At home, they put this on the toilet themselves and just go. It is more stable than the other plastic potty chairs. The big plastic chairs tend to wobble and move around but this holds perfectly still and supports them fine. It does not pinch them. Finally, it fits our elongated toilet seat perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fiebrink

customer_reviews.title: Love this potty seat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old that is currently potty training. I mainly purchased this since its portable and can fold. I love how this was packaged. It came with it's own little punch and was in a ziplock bag and had plastic attached to it. It can easily be folded up and stored in a diaper bag. I love how it has little latches for a more secure hold. This makes it easier to potty train while on the go. It held up my 40lbs toddler with no problem! I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Shandon

customer_reviews.title: You need this for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! You can take it to go and it comes with 2 bags. Fits perfectly in your purse or bag. Easy to clean. We actually use it at home a lot too in our main bathroom. It is easier to sit on for my toddler. The only thing is that the owl eyes rubbed off easy on mine but it doesn't bother me. I bought it for the usefulness not that owl eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Kids want to use this at home
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my three and five year olds while out and about yesterday. The littler one asked to use it at home, instead of his regular potty training seat. It has little things that flip out to help it stay on the toilet seat. It is more slippery on the seat than the one we have at home and it does not have the splash guard which we kind of need. So that was a scene but it serves its purpose, seems sturdy enough and folds up and away easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kim from MD

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful in Potty Training
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It’s simple, easy to clean, and comes in a small bag to contain the ickiness in the diaper bag. I haven’t found a toilet seat that it didn’t fit on, the rubber pads on the bottom keep it from sliding around. After using it with 2 kids for a few months, the decorative drawing on the top has started scratching off, but it in no way hinders it’s use. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry with you
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter was happy when she saw it knew what is was for her favorite color is pink. Love it folds up so easy and easy to clean we take it with us every where we go stores , family and friends houses don’t have to worry about her falling in toilet she puts it on the seat by herself love the travel bag too easy and small enough to carry in a backpack best thing ever.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS SEAT! My 2 year old wouldn't sit on the traditional potty training toilet. She's very much like a mini adult and wants to do things like mama and papa do. This allowed her to sit on the toilet by herself and have direct access to toilet paper and flushing too! Yesterday she actually put herself on the toilet (I have step stool at the toilet and at the sink and she can do it all on her own) Only few days into potty training
customer_reviews.author: Babi

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this item when I used it at home
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this item when I used it at home. It fit the toliet great! I was also excited how great if folds up. But we went for first outting at the zoo and it fit horribly. It was sliding around and when I put my daughter on it, it fell into the toliet. Since I'll mainly use it for public toilets I'm disappointed. I originally gave this product 3 stars but they've refunded my money and they have good customer service so I've bumped it up to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for an upcoming 3 week trip. I thought it would be ideal for airplane and traveling to different houses and places around town. I purchased disposable covers to use along with this in public places. I absolutely love it! So easy to use, even my 2 1/2 year old can fold and unfold it. He loves his owl and it’s gotten a lot of use since it arrived before our trip. Great to fit in stroller, purse or diaper bag. Can easily be used on any toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough, Not Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: It does have the potential to slide around if pushed the right way. I thought it clipped to the toilet somehow. But it does NOT slide most of the time. Perfect size for my petite 2.5 year old. But it does hurt my 40lb 4 year old's butt and leave a ring sometimes. He prefers it not be on the toilet. The owl did fade a little after cleaning the seat with some standard Clorox spray bathroom cleaner so be careful. I only wish this came with a hook to hang it on the side of the toilet when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: TechA

product_meta.title: Gimars Upgrade Stable Folding Travel Portable Potty Training Seat Fits Most Toilets, No Falling in with 6 Large Non-slip Silicone Pad, Home Reusable with Carry Bag for Toddlers and Kids, Blue
feature_bullets: Upgrade Version 6 pcs Large Nonslip Silicone Pads - Increasing 6 pcs Non Slip padding, not like other suppliers 2 pcs and increase the contact area of friction between the toilet cover and potty training seat, avoiding your babies falling off to the toilet effectively

No Gap to Pinch - Enhance the tightness of joint, more firmly, no gap design solve the problem of pinches bottom. Fits Most standard toilet, helps babies learn how to use toilet bowl in restroom with more confidence when you are out and about

Freely switch Foldable To Unfoldable Design - Toilet Seat cover Folds up pretty small size of 7''L x 6''W x 2''H to bring to public restrooms easily and perfect for your children's away-from-home bathroom's needs and compact for "on the go" and traveling; Also can stay Unfoldable 13.5''L x 11 ''W x 1''H, Perfect for every baby potty training everyday use at home

Unique Cute Owl Design - Bright Color and Carton images toddler potty seat come with nice plastic zip waterproof storage and carry bag, The toilet training ring is suitable for a little bit older baby about 3 years old and up to 60 lbs. Easy to clean by water
Buy with confidence - Our customer service is always ready to help within hours.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,288 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
